content.description: On the wall approximately 50 feet left of the tower and just left of Yesterday's Hangover is an obvious heart-shaped ceiling. Rope up on a small left below the ceiling. Climb cracks to a belay just below the ceiling. A short pitch leads around the ceiling to a hanging belay with a bolt. The third pitch heads up and left to a bush on the skyline. Scramble to the top.
content.protection: Several micro cams/nuts to 1/2", and a few to 2".
content.location: On the wall approximately 50 feet left of the tower and just left of Yesterday's Hangover.

climbs.name: Yesterday's Hangover
climbs.fa: E.C. Joe, John McGee, Brian Hodges (12/1975)

content.description: A few yards left of Owl's Revenge is a left-facing open book. Climb the book past a large chockstone to a belay ledge. Climb up the righthand crack on the headwall to a lichen-covered V slot, then to a three-inch crack on the left wall of the slot. Above is a belay on a ledge next to Bird Head Flake. Underclinging left to the left edge of the huge flake where a crack is found. Aid climbing leads to the top.
content.location: A few yards left of Owl's Revenge.

content.description: Between The Owl's Anus and Yesterday's Hangover is a jamcrack/lieback which leads to an overhanging slot. Jam cracks past the slot to a slimy traverse left to the belay bolts of Yesterday's Hangover. Continue up or rappel.
content.location: Between The Owl's Anus and Yesterday's Hangover

content.description: On the right side of the tower is an impressive jam crack on a short wall below a chimney. Climb the crack to an alcove at the base of the chimney and belay.
content.location: On the right side of the tower.

content.description: This route follows an obvious chimney to the left of the tower. Use the cracks in the chimney and the chimney itself. Exit through a tiny hole beneath a huge chockstone to reach the top.

Approximately 1.8 miles east of Owl Rock is a large turnout with a boulder in it's center. Across the road from the turnout, to the south and high on a hill is a large rock tower with a prominent crack on its north side. Climb this crack to the summit.
content.location: Approximately 1.8 miles east of Owl Rock is a large turnout with a boulder in it's center. Across the road from the turnout, to the south and high on a hill is a large rock tower with a prominent crack on its north side. Climb this crack to the summit.

content.description: Far left of The Earthworm is an 80 foot crack which ends at a large tree. The crux is the start. Easier climbing lies above. Currently there are no rappel bolts, so the only way down is to rappel from the tree.

Left 60 feet of the hear-shaped ceiling is a short offwidth on a right-facing wall. Climb up easy ledges to the crack and follow it to a ledge with loose rocks. Walk left to a corner. Jam and chimney the corner to a grass ledge and belay. The second pitch goes left up an easy chimney to a huge chockstone. Crawl or squirm through a hole beneath it and jam an offwidth to the top.
content.location: Left 60 feet of The Roost route.

content.description: Across from  Owl Tower is a rock buttress with a chimney on its south face. Follow the chimney to its top.
content.location: cross from  Owl Tower is a rock buttress with a chimney on its south face.
